decks.notes: This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by utilizing a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, and versatile planeswalkers like Jace, Vraska, Oko, and Liliana. The deck aims to control the board state and outvalue the opponent with card advantage from Dig Through Time and Courser of Kruphix. It also includes mana ramp with Gilded Goose to help cast its higher cost spells. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around controlling the game and grinding out wins through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate card advantage and deal damage efficiently by utilizing the Arclight Phoenix along with various spells like Fiery Temper and Lightning Axe. The goal is to fill up the graveyard with spells and then bring back the Phoenix to pressure the opponent while controlling the board with cards like Thing in the Ice. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, taking advantage of burst damage and tempo plays to close out the game swiftly.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. It also aims to control the board with powerful planeswalkers such as Oko, Thief of Crowns and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy. Additionally, the deck includes versatile cards like Dig Through Time for card advantage and Scavenging Ooze for graveyard hate. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the deck's diverse color requirements, allowing for flexibility in playing both proactive and reactive game plans.

The main idea behind this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Tempest Djinn, Thassa, God of the Sea, and Merfolk Trickster. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Quench and Siren Stormtamer to protect your creatures and counter your opponent's spells. With a focus on tempo and evasion, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of evasive threats and disruptive spells while generating additional value from cards like Smuggler's Copter and Brazen Borrower.

The deck focuses on creating an infinite combo loop using Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to repeatedly copy the Felidar Guardian's ability, allowing for infinite tokens and potential win condition. The deck includes cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board and protect the combo pieces, while mana ramp cards like Gilded Goose and Llanowar Elves help accelerate the combo. The deck also includes versatile cards like Reflector Mage and Brazen Borrower for additional control and disruption. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces and ensure consistency in executing the combo.

The main concept of this deck is to create infinite loops by using the interaction between Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to continuously create token copies of Felidar Guardian. This allows the player to repeatedly exile and return permanents to the battlefield, generating values and potentially overwhelming the opponent with a powerful board presence. The deck also includes supporting cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect the combo pieces. The inclusion of ramp creatures and card draw spells help to ensure the combo can be assembled quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. Utilizing a mix of card draw and burn spells, it aims to cast multiple spells in a single turn to trigger the Phoenix's ability and pressure the opponent. With a combination of cheap spells and powerful creatures like Thing in the Ice, the deck can quickly shift from control to aggression, overwhelming the opponent before they can set up their own game plan.

The main focus of this Pioneer Aggro deck is to efficiently cycle through cards, generate card advantage, and quickly fill the graveyard to bring back Arclight Phoenix as a powerful recurring threat. The deck utilizes a mix of discard spells, draw spells, and burn spells to control the board and provide reach to close out the game. With a combination of evasion from flyers and flipping Thing in the Ice to clear the opponent's board, this deck aims to be proactive and apply pressure early in the game.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push, and powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Liliana, the Last Hope. The deck also utilizes cards like Grim Flayer and Tireless Tracker to generate card advantage and provide board presence. The deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent by efficiently answering threats and gradually pulling ahead in the card advantage race.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By playing powerful creatures like Champion of Dusk, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Drana, Liberator of Malakir, as well as utilizing cards like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord and Gray Merchant of Asphodel, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Thoughtseize and Fatal Push help control the opponent's board while Castle Locthwain and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx provide card advantage and mana ramp. Overall, the deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent and maintaining a strong board presence.

The main goal of this deck is to assemble the Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian combo, which allows you to create an infinite loop of creatures entering and leaving the battlefield, resulting in an infinite number of hasty 1/4 token creatures. To support this combo, the deck includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to protect it, along with cards like Lava Coil and Fiery Impulse for removal. The deck also includes card draw spells like Anticipate and Dig Through Time to help find the combo pieces quickly. It is a fast-paced and powerful combo deck focused on winning the game through the combo interaction.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly by utilizing cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, Leyline of Abundance, and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. This allows for explosive plays with high-cost creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Polukranos, World Eater. Oath of Nissa and Once Upon a Time help to find key pieces of the deck, while cards like Walking Ballista and Oko, Thief of Crowns provide valuable removal and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive devotion to green and powerful board presence.

This deck focuses on the combo synergy between Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai, creating infinite copies of Guardian to win the game. The deck also includes control elements like Supreme Verdict and Teferi, Time Raveler to stall until the combo is assembled. Card draw and selection allow for consistent access to combo pieces, while Detention Sphere and Abrade provide removal options. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the combo pieces and provide the necessary colors for spells. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate a high amount of green mana through cards like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Leyline of Abundance, to enable explosive plays and ramp into powerful green devotion cards such as Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Nylea, God of the Hunt. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its early game aggression and mana ramp, while also providing late-game finishers like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. Overall, the deck is centered around maximizing green mana production and utilizing powerful green devotion cards for a swift victory.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian combo, which allows for an infinite loop of creating hasty 4/4 tokens. The deck also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Oko, Thief of Crowns for disruption and protection. The mana base is designed to support the colors needed for the combo pieces, with some acceleration provided by cards like Llanowar Elves and Gilded Goose. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a board full of powerful creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up a large amount of green mana as quickly as possible, utilizing cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World, Leyline of Abundance, and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx. This mana is then used to cast powerful threats such as Hydroid Krasis and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck is aggressive in nature, aiming to overwhelm the opponent with fast mana acceleration and impactful creatures, while also using cards like Walking Ballista for additional reach and removal. The goal is to quickly establish board control and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main focus of the deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. The key idea is to maintain a fast pace of play, keeping pressure on the opponent and finishing the game before they have a chance to stabilize. Cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear help to boost the damage output of creatures, while burn spells like Wizard's Lightning and Lightning Strike provide direct damage to finish off the opponent. Ramunap Ruins can also be used as a last resort for additional damage.

The main concept of this Pioneer Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to focus on quick and efficient damage dealing to the opponent. By including a mix of low-cost and burn spells, along with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Rampaging Ferocidon, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and seize control of the game early on. The inclusion of cards like Boros Charm and Hazoret the Fervent further enhances the deck's ability to deal damage efficiently and close out games swiftly.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with early aggressive creatures and generating a high amount of green mana through devotion. Nissa and Leyline of Abundance help ramp up mana production, while Burning-Tree Emissary and Elvish Mystic provide quick mana acceleration. Vivien, Arkbow Ranger and Walking Ballista offer versatile removal and additional threats. The deck aims to build a strong board presence quickly and maintain pressure on the opponent with powerful green spells and creatures. The combination of devotion to green and aggro tactics makes it a formidable force in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up your mana quickly using cards like Elvish Mystic, Llanowar Elves, and Leyline of Abundance, in order to deploy powerful Green creatures like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with large threats early in the game, using cards like Walking Ballista and Voracious Hydra to maintain board presence and pressure your opponent. The deck is designed to be efficient and aggressive, using its devotion to Green to its advantage and keeping the pressure on the opponent.
